article_node.title: DC mayor travels to Martha's Vineyard amid Trump's federalized crime crackdown of city
article_node.summary: Washington, D.C. Mayor Muriel Bowser traveled to Martha's Vineyard for a family commitment while President Donald Trump has federalized the city's police department due to rising crime rates. Bowser criticized Trump's actions as an intrusion on the city's autonomy, despite acknowledging a decrease in overall crime rates. The federalization comes amid concerns over violent crime, particularly involving juveniles, with Trump asserting that his intervention is necessary to restore safety in the capital.
